description:
Job Details

Job Location

FMP Consulting Headquarters - Arlington, VA

Position Type

Full Time

Description

FMP Consulting (FMP) is a leading management and strategic consulting firm. With extensive expertise in both the government and private sectors, FMP’s knowledgeable and experienced staff have served as outside experts and trusted collaborators across a variety of clients. Beginning with the firm’s founding in 1991, FMP has embraced the core values of partnership, flexibility, and service . These values form the foundation of our approach and guide us in every aspect of our work.

For the thirteenth year in a row, FMP has been recognized by the Northern Virginia Family Services with the Companies as Responsive Employers (CARE) Award. FMP Consulting is also proud to announce that we were recognized in the Washington Post’s Top Places to Work in 2020 and 2021. We are committed to fostering a collaborative and inclusive work environment while providing excellent service to our clients.

We are currently seeking a Managing Consultant to join our growing team.

A Managing Consultant at FMP will have the opportunity to:
• Serve as a trusted advisor to clients, ensure FMP’s reputation remains in the highest standing, and that our work results in high quality, innovative deliverables
• Manage a p ortfolio of projects and lead project teams to meet client goals in a dynamic and high-performance environment. Examples of efforts may include:
• Lead teams to identify and validate competencies and KSAs for client organizations in accordance with legal and professional standards
• Lead teams to apply and implement competencies across a range of human capital processes (e.g., competency gap assessments, competency-based hiring practices, competency-based training)
• Lead teams in the design, development and administration of surveys
• Lead teams to conduct advanced data analyses, including quantitative and qualitative analysis
• Partner with clients on projects such as workforce planning, workload models, strategic planning, and succession planning
• Serve on the management team and contribute to strategic and tactical decisions
• Shape FMP’s culture of high performance through continuous feedback to consultants
• Model collaborative communication to make sure teams are functioning well and team morale remains high
• Supervise, develop and mentor a team of approximately 8-12 consultants
• Lead innovative and competitive business development efforts to result in a healthy portfolio of projects and business growth
• Utilize expertise to expand work with existing clients and generate new clients
• Improve FMP by leading and encouraging participation in internal initiatives, expanding network of resources, and helping recruit top talent

Qualifications

The minimum qualifications for a Managing Consultant are:
• 8-10 years of related experience
• Master’s degree, or bachelor’s degree with additional experience, in an area of study related to industrial organizational psychology, human resources, organizational development, business, or government administration
• Demonstrated skill in:
• Written and oral communication
• Developing positive and professional networking relationships
• Report writing and the production of deliverables
• Problem solving; analysis; critical thinking
• Balancing multiple priorities and tasks
• Complex project management
• Team leadership

The Preferred Qualifications For a Managing Consultant Are
• Broad knowledge and experience working with Federal government human capital and/or management practices
• Significant client management and business development experience
• Related professional certification
• Doctorate degree in a field of study relating to data analysis or business, industrial organizational psychology, or human resources
• Demonstrated thought leadership and knowledge of current research and I/O practices

Disclosures

Applicants selected may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. All qualified applicants will receive fair and impartial consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, age, status as a protected veteran, genetic information, or other legally protected status.

Diversity and Inclusion Statement: We are committed to an inclusive and positive culture that supports all employees and values diversity in all forms. We value diverse perspectives and experiences and seek to create an environment that embraces innovation and information sharing in a safe and inclusive space. This isn’t just a smart business practice—it is a fundamental characteristic of the organization we want to be and an area where we continue to learn and grow.

Disclosures: Position openings for this role are contingent on current or anticipated client needs. Applicants selected may be subject to a government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. As a Federal Contractor, FMP Consulting follows Federal employment drug law which forbids the use of marijuana regardless of state laws.
